Title: Train crushes dispatch rider in Lagos
Summary: Lagos State Traffic Management Authority renewed its call for caution and strict adherence to traffic rules following a fatal collision between a moving train and a dispatch rider at the PWD Railway Level Crossing in Ikeja .

Title: IPOB female logistics supplier arrested in Abia
Summary: A female IPOB/ESN logistics supplier has been arrested by the military in Abia State . Troops recorded successes against terrorists and criminal elements across theatres of operation nationwide in the past week .

Title: NBA-SPIDEL, police to review tinted permit enforcement
Summary: The Nigerian Bar Association Section on Public Interest and Development Law (NBA-SPIDEL) and the Nigeria Police Force have agreed to undertake a comprehensive review of the tinted permit policy . The Nigerian Police Force will review the policy to ensure that its enforcement aligns with public interest and national interest .

Summary: Veteran journalists hail Taraba gov for key appointments . Former Deputy National President of the SWAN has lauded Taraba State governor for recognising the contributions of journalists .

Title: Family faults inclusion of Herbert Macaulay in presidential pardon list
Summary: Herbert Macaulay family of Lagos, on Thursday, broke its silence over the pardon granted by President Bola Tinubu to their patriarch . They say the clemench should not have been lumped up with drug barons, ex-convicts and murderers .

Title: Gunfire, panic as mourners gather for Raila Odinga in Nairobi
Summary: Panic erupted at Kasarani Stadium in Nairobi as security forces fired shots to control surging crowds gathered to view the body of Kenya’s late opposition leader, Raila Odinga, whose remains were repatriated from India .

Title: UK reaffirms support for Anambra election process
Summary: UK reaffirms support for Anambra election process . Talks focused on preparations for the election, security arrangements, voter turnout, and observation of the electoral process .

Title: Rivers judiciary pardons 150 inmates
Summary: Rivers State Judiciary has released 150 inmates from various correctional centres across the state . The move is part of efforts to decongestate the facilities .

Title: Navy foils diesel smuggling attempt, intercepts boat with 4,000 litres of AGO
Summary: The Nigerian Navy Ship NNS Beecroft, Apapa, Lagos, has foiled an attempt to smuggle 4,000 litres of Automotive Gas Oil (AGO) suspected to have been siphoned around the approaches to the Commodore Pool area near Atlas Cove .

Title: Raila Odinga: Gunfire, panic at Nairobi stadium as Kenyans gather
Summary: Opposition leader Raila Odinga, 80, died at a health clinic in southern India on Wednesday, triggering a huge outpouring of grief across much of his home country .
